title.description: Concise, descriptive title for the bounty

description.description: Bounties are climate-positive tasks. The description should briefly describe what the bounty is about, which will help users on Impact Miner. Bounties can range from providing proof of composting setup at home to building smart contracts that can help fight climate change.

bounty_type.description: The bounty type hints users on the Impact Miner as to what the bounty is about. Users choose bounties based on their strengths, or as we say 'superpowers'.

dominant_impact_core.description: There are 4 types of Impact Cores, choose one that the bounty is majorly trying to solve for. Eg: the dominant impact core to map groundwater wells in a specific region would be water

bounty_mode.description: Digital Bounties are those bounties which a user can take up from anywhere in the world. Eg: Providing ideas for a community outreach programme. Physical bounties are those which require the user to be at a specific location for them to accept and complete the bounty. Eg: Mapping groundwater wells in a specific region.

max_attempts.description: This determines how many times the same user can attempt the bounty on Impact Miner. It depends on what type of bounty it is. For ex, if a bounty requires the user to submit an essay it could have less number of attempts but a bounty like taking surveys where the user has to collect information multiple times could have more attempts

completion_criteria.description: Criteria that must be met for a bounty submission to be considered complete and valid
default_values: Complete all required microtasks; optional ones are clearly marked
Upload real media with GPS coordinates where applicable (preferable)
Only one entry per user; re-submissions are not allowed
All validation is done by Team Atlantis and is final
Providing fake, reused, or unrelated media not captured by the user may result in blacklisting
Uploads must be clear, complete, and relevant
Do not submit dummy data or leave empty fields; only one submission per user is allowed
Users may use 'skip' and 'back' options to explore the bounty steps but MUST NOT submit unless fully ready
For help, use the in-app support system

microtasks.description: List of microtasks required to complete the bounty. At least one is required.

READING_INSTRUCTION.description: Instructional text for the user to read.

UPLOAD_PHOTO.description: User uploads one or more photos.

best_practices: READING_INSTRUCTION in the beginning (intro) is nice to have.
Have an ASK_A_QUESTION for optional notes/links that appears at the end.
UPLOAD_FILE should be placed towards the end.
recommendations: Mix different task types for engagement
Include clear success criteria for each task
